isis.stitle: ANTILOCK TRACTION CONTROL RELAY VALVE: BENDIX ATR-2 - ASSEMBLE

svcproc.title: ASSEMBLE
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 11for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Prior to assembly, lubricate all O-rings, seals, and pistons, as well as body and cover bores, using silicone lubricant.
Install O-ring (Item 31) on the new inlet valve seat (Item 32).
Install the small end of the new inlet/ exhaust valve spring (Item 34) over the rubber of the new valve (Item 33) making sure the spring coils rest on the valve's four tabs.
Insert the spring and valve in the valve seat (Item 32), making sure the four tabs are within the seat's bore.

Insert the valve, seat and spring assembly into the proportioning piston (Item 28) and while holding the seat (Item 32) in place, install retaining ring (Item 30) to secure it in the piston (Item 28). Make certain the retaining ring is fully seated in its groove. Make sure the valve is straight, against the exhaust seat and free to move.
Install both the large and small diameter O-rings (Items 27 and 29) on the proportioning piston (Item 28).

Install both the large and small diameter O-rings (Items 25 and 26) on the blend back piston (Item 24), then insert the small diameter of the proportioning piston (Item 28) into the small diameter end of the blend back piston (Item 24).
Carefully insert the assembled proportioning and blend back pistons (Items 24 and 28) into the bore in the cover (Item 2). Do not cut or pinch the O-rings.

With the bore of the cover facing up, install the spring cage (Item 23) in the blend back piston (Item 24) so that its flat side rests against the blend back piston. The concave side of the spring cage should face toward the spring (Item 22) which is installed next.
Install the spring (Item 22) in the cage (Item 23) so that its coils are within the I.D. of the cage.
Install the small and large diameter O-rings (Items 44 and 37) on the inlet seat (Item 36) then insert the inlet seat into the bore in the cover (Item 2).
Install the small and large diameter O-rings (Items 21 and 20) on the check valve seat (Item 16).
Install the spring (Item 19) on the inlet seat (Item 36) so that the small diameter fits over and around the air passage through the center of the inlet seat.
Install the check valve (Item 17) and valve guide (Item 18) in the check valve seat (Item 16).

note.para: The check valve must be installed so that the top half portion fits into the valve seat (Item 16).

step1.para: Install the valve guide (Item 18) so that its flange contains (surrounds) the coils of the large end of the spring (Item 19), when the valve seat (Item 16) is installed in the cover (Item 2). Use a small amount of grease to hold these parts in the valve seat.

Install the assembled valve seat (Item 16) with the check valve and valve guide (Items 17 and 18) into the cover (Item 2) bore and while holding it in place, install the retaining ring (Item 15). Make certain the retaining ring is fully seated in its groove.

Install the valve retainer (Item 8) on the inlet and exhaust valve (Item 9) so that the flange of the retainer (Item 8) surrounds the rubber portion of the valve. Install the inlet and exhaust valve in the body (Item 1).
Install the inlet and exhaust valve return spring (Item 7) in the body (Item 1).

Install the large and small diameter O-rings (Items 5 and 6) in the exhaust cover (Item 4), then install the exhaust cover in the body (Item 1) taking care not to damage the O-rings. Hold the exhaust cover in place.
While depressing the exhaust cover (Item 4), install the retaining ring (Item 3) in the body (Item 1). Make certain the retainer (Item 3) is fully seated in its groove in the body.
If the valve was equipped with a relay piston return spring (Item 14), install the spring in the body, large diameter first.
Using lubricant to hold them in place, install the large and small sealing rings (Items 11 and 35) on the cover (Item 2).
Install the O-ring (Item 13) on the relay piston (Item 12), then install the piston in the body (Item 1).

Note the relationship marks made prior to disassembly, then install the cover (Item 2) on the body (Item 1). Secure the cover (Item 2) on the body (Item 1) using the two, short capscrews (Item 40). Again, noting the relationship marks, secure the bracket (Item 41) on the cover (Item 2) and body (Item 1) using the two long capscrews (Item 10) and two nuts and washers (Item 43). Tighten the four capscrews to 120 to 150 in-lbs. (13.5 to 17 N•m).
Install the two capscrews (Item 42) that secure the bracket (Item 41) to the cover (Item 2) and tighten to 180 to 220 in-lbs. (20 to 25 N•m).

Noting the relationship marks made during disassembly, secure the controller (Item 39) to the cover (Item 2) using the four capscrews (Item 38). Tighten the four capscrews to 50 to 80 in-lbs. (5.6 to 9 N•m).
Install all air line fittings and plugs making certain thread sealing material does not enter the valve.
Install the rebuilt valve on the vehicle and perform the OPERATION AND LEAKAGE TESTSbefore placing the vehicle in service.
